div.head: 6.6.1884 Freitag
div.p: Walked up the Lindenberg this morning in Wernigerode, from where there is a very fine view on to the castle and town. We then went down the Burgstrasse where I bought a very nice little stick for 90 pf. We had already ordered our carriage, so when we came home after having breakfasted we drove away to Rübeland. The road went through Eltingerode, where we saw the Blaue Engel in which aunt Lulu was almost eaten up by fleas last time she was here. From there we drove to the hotel Grüne Tanne in 30 minutes. From the Grüne Tanne we had to go up a rather steep hill to the Bauman’s Höhle a large grotto but not so large as Remouchamps. We walked in a kind of procession. The guide first the aunt Lulu and last a young couple in their honeymoon They did nothing but call each other „Liebchen“ and „Mäuschen“ and „Engel“ etc. Each of us men had a lamp; the guide also lit some limelight in some places. From Rübeland we drove on to Treseburg. The way down to Treseburg is one of the most beautiful in the Harz. On both sides are high mountains covered with firtrees etc. which look like feathers in the distance, and down in the valley the Bode rushes through. On the way to Treseburg we went up to the Wilhelmsblick from which one can see the Bode for a long way. Down at Treseburg we had some very good sour milk at the Weisse Hirsch. From Treseburg we drove uphill to the Rosstrappe where we are staying this night. From the Hotel we directly walked on to the Rosstrappe with the horseshoe. From the Rassmannshöhe we had a beautiful view into the Bodethal on to the Teufels Brücke. The scenery was wild and grand beyond description. The Hexentanzplatz we could also see. From my window here I have got a very far view: Halberstadt, Quedlinburg, Thale etc and the hills in the distance, the whole now lit by the moon, and the thousand little lights of the towns and villages are very picturesque.
